author: TravisEz13
body:
Before submitting this pull request, please first:
- [ ] State that it "Resolves #xyz".
- [X] Ensure your code is up-to-date with `master`.
- [ ] Add tests that fail without your changes.
- [X] Update all relevant [documentation](../docs).
- [ ] Assign the PR to the appropriate subsystem [maintainer](https://aka.ms/psowners).
- [ ] Check that your commits follow our [contributing guidelines](CONTRIBUTING.md)

Could not find an owner for docs.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @TravisEz13 did you test that this does actually work correctly on Windows? If so, we should add some Pester tests.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: When it is installed SxS, New-PSSession works against the built-in PowerShell and remote machines

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Sweet! Let's add a Pester test that runs on AppVeyor. I imagine there are some session unit tests somewhere? @JamesWTruher might know.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I think we should keep the doc issue separate from the test issue.  Submitted issue #1166 to track this issue.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Blah, I hate random build failures. @TravisEz13 can you rebase to trigger another run?

title: Qualify new-pssession known issue
